lines.content: * Represents a deadline task with a due date.
* A deadline task has a description and must be completed by a specific date.
* Creates a deadline task with the given description and due date.
* @param deadline    Due date of the task.
* Creates a deadline task using a date string.
* The date string is expected to be in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format.
* @param deadlineStr Due date as a string.
* Returns the due date of this deadline task.
* Returns the type code of this task.
* Returns a user-facing string representation of this deadline task.
* Represents an event task with a start time and an end time.
* An event task has a description and occurs between two specified time points.
* Creates an event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param from        Start time of the event.
* @param to          End time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the start time of the event.
* Returns the end time of the event.
* Returns the type code of this task.
* Returns a user-facing string representation of this event task.
* A parsed command consists of a command word and the remaining arguments
* Creates a parsed command with the given command word and arguments.
* @param arguments   The arguments associated with the command.
* Returns the arguments of the command.
* Parses raw user input into a structured command representation.
* This class is responsible for splitting the user input into a command word
* Parses the given user input and returns a {@link ParsedCommand}.
* @param userInput Full command entered by the user.
* @return A parsed command containing the command word and arguments.
* @throws TomException If the input is empty or contains only whitespace.
public static ParsedCommand parse(String userInput) throws TomException {
throw new TomException("Command cannot be empty.");
* Handles loading and saving tasks to a local file for persistence.
* Tasks are stored in a plain text format, one task per line.
* This class is responsible for converting between {@link Task} objects and their
* serialized representation in the storage file.
private static final Path DIR = Paths.get("data");
private static final Path FILE = DIR.resolve("tom.Tom.txt");
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* If the file does not exist or cannot be read, an empty list will be returned.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from storage.
// Returns whatever has been loaded so far (or empty list) if reading fails.
* Saves the given list of tasks to the storage file.
* If the data directory does not exist, it will be created automatically.
* @param tasks List of tasks to be saved.
// Saving failed; the program continues without crashing.
* Converts a task into a single-line string representation for storage.
// Falls back to saving as a todo if the type is unrecognized.
* Parses a single line from storage into a {@link Task}.
* Returns {@code null} if the line is invalid or cannot be parsed.
* @param line One line from the storage file.
* @return Parsed task, or {@code null} if parsing fails.
* Represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* A task can be marked as done or not done. Subclasses specify the
* concrete type of the task (e.g., Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Creates a task with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns the status icon of this task.
* @return "X" if the task is done; otherwise a single space.
* Returns the description of this task.
* Returns whether this task is completed.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Returns the type code of this task.
* Subclasses provide the concrete type code.
* Returns a user-facing string representation of this task.
* Provides basic operations to add, retrieve, remove, and query tasks in the list.
* Creates a task list with an existing list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* Returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the given index.
* Removes and returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to remove.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the underlying list of tasks.
* This is mainly used for persistence purposes.
* Finds tasks whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* A todo task has a description and no associated date or time.
* Creates a todo task with the given description.
* @param description Description of the todo task.
* Returns the type code of this task.
* Entry point of the chatbot application.
* This class starts the program, reads user commands in a loop, and coordinates interactions
* between the UI, task list, command parser, and storage.
* Reads commands from the user, executes them, and persists changes when needed.
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
ui.showMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");

ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new TomException("tom.Deadline must have /by YYYY-MM-DD");

ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new TomException("Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format, e.g., 2019-10-15");

ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");

ui.showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");

* Represents an exception specific to the Tom application.
* This exception is thrown when a user command is invalid or cannot be processed.
* Creates a TomException with the specified detail message.
* @param message Detail message explaining the cause of the exception.
* Handles all user interface interactions for the application.
* This class is responsible for displaying messages to the user and
* reading user input from the standard input.
* Creates a UI instance that reads input from standard input.
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
* @param name Name of the application or chatbot.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Reads a command entered by the user.
* @return The user input as a string.
* Displays a message to the user.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Closes resources used by the UI.
